title: Project Planning
description: Define project scope, goals, and requirements. Identify stakeholders and gather their input. Create a project plan with milestones and timelines.

title: Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data model, application logic, and user interface components. The architecture should consider the following aspects: 1) Separation of concerns between the front-end, back-end, and data layers (following SOLID principles). 2) Modular design to allow for easy maintenance and scalability (using microservices architecture where appropriate). 3) Integration with existing HR systems and data sources (specifically mention the systems like HRIS, ATS, Payroll systems, and provide APIs or protocols for integration). 4) Support for different user roles and access controls (define these roles such as Employee, Manager, Admin, Super Admin, and specify the permissions for each role). 5) Robust error handling and logging mechanisms (include a centralized logging system). 6) Performance optimizations for handling large datasets (provide some best practices or specific strategies, such as using indexes, caching, and pagination). 7) Consideration of data privacy and security measures (implement end-to-end encryption, enforce strict access controls, follow OWASP guidelines). 8) Document the architecture design in a clear and concise manner for easy understanding and implementation (use UML diagrams where necessary, write comprehensive technical documentation). 9) Implement unit tests and integration tests to ensure the robustness of the system. 10) Assess the system's impact on the existing infrastructure and provide recommendations for necessary upgrades or enhancements.

title: Database Design for CareerMoveSimulator
description: Design the database schema to store career data, employee profiles, simulation results, and related metadata. Consider data normalization, indexing strategies, scalability requirements, data privacy/security measures for sensitive employee information, compatibility with future architectural changes in the CareerMoveSimulator project, and optimize the design to be efficient for read and write operations. Also, ensure that the database design aligns well with the overall system architecture. Suggest a database management system (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB) that best fits our needs considering performance, scalability, and data model complexity. Additionally, consider sharding strategies to handle large datasets if necessary.

title: User Interface Design for CareerMoveSimulator
description: Design the user interface for the career move simulator, including input forms, visualization tools, reporting features, and accessibility considerations. The design should align with the overall application architecture (including UX/UI guidelines), user experience research findings, performance optimization best practices, and adhere to web standards such as WCAG 2.1 for accessibility. Collaborate with frontend-developer for technical implementation details, ensuring that the design is feasible from a development perspective. Consider ongoing collaboration with code-architect for architectural alignment and scalability concerns.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the application logic, including career simulation algorithms, data processing, and integration with other systems.

title: Frontend Development
description: Develop the user interface components based on the approved design, ensuring a smooth and intuitive user experience.

title: Security Review
description: Conduct a thorough security review of the application, identifying potential vulnerabilities and implementing necessary security measures.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the production environment, configure continuous integration and deployment pipelines, and automate the release process.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Create user manuals, technical documentation, and training materials for end-users and administrators.
